column1: Marigot is the main town and capital in the French Collectivity of Saint Martin.
== History and features ==
Originally a fishing village on a swamp for which it was named
column2: Marigot was made capital during the reign of King Louis XVI
column3: who built Fort St. Louis on a hill near Marigot Bay. Today
column4: that building is the most important in Marigot.

column1: Marigot is typical of Caribbean towns
column2: with gingerbread houses and sidewalk bistros. Market days are every Wednesday and Saturday morning.

column1: The crew of the 1997 motion picture Speed 2 shot the final scene here where the Seabourn Legend hits the island.
The St. Martin of Tours' Church on rue du Fort Louis was built in 1941.
== Geography ==
Marigot is located on the west coast of the island of St. Martin. It extends from the coast to the west
column2: along the Bay of Marigot and the hills of the interior of the island to the east. On the south-west it is bounded by the Simpson Bay.

column1: === Climate ===
Marigot has a tropical savanna climate (Köppen Aw)
column2: with very warm to hot and humid weather throughout the year. Rainfall – which is reduced by the rain shadow of the mountains to the east – is not as extreme as in most climates of this type
column3: with the peak occurring from August to November due to hurricanes.

column1: == Transport ==
The city is served by Princess Juliana International Airport as well as L'Espérance Airport. There is a ferry to Blowing Point
